channel.title: Tomorrow Will Be Televised
channel.description: An audio series covering the world of television and the people making that world happen. Besides TV news items and commentary, Tomorrow features interviews with network TV executives, show producers/creators, entrepreneurs launching new TV programming and technology, TV critics and pundits. The program runs Monday afternoons from 3-4 p.m. Eastern time/noon-1 p.m. Pacific time over BlogTalkRadio (http://www.blogtalkradio.com/simonapple04).
channel.itunes:subtitle: An audio series covering the world of television.. TV news items, commentary, and interviews with network TV executives, show producers/creators, and entrepreneurs. Live, challenging, informative, and fresh TV-related news.
channel.itunes:author: Simon Applebaum
channel.itunes:summary: An audio series covering the world of television and the people making that world happen. Besides TV news items and commentary, Tomorrow features interviews with network TV executives, show producers/creators, entrepreneurs launching new TV programming and technology, TV critics and pundits. The program runs Monday afternoons from 3-4 p.m. Eastern time/noon-1 p.m. Pacific time over BlogTalkRadio (http://www.blogtalkradio.com/simonapple04).

item.title: Tomorrow Will Be Televised 5-25-12, Arthur Wylie
item.itunes:author: Simon Applebaum
item.itunes:subtitle: With so many ways to get a television series to you, from broadcast networks to Netflix, there's a gold rush of people in line to enter the series-making scene. Entrepreneur Arthur Wylie is launching his bid to be a TV mogul, one with diversity at the cor
item.itunes:summary: With so many ways to get a television series to you, from broadcast networks to Netflix, there's a gold rush of people in line to enter the series-making scene. Entrepreneur Arthur Wylie is launching his bid to be a TV mogul, one with diversity at the core.

item.title: Tomorrow Will Be Televised 5-25-12, Tom Jennings
item.itunes:author: Simon Applebaum
item.itunes:subtitle: Joel Glenn went on a tour of duty in Vietnam in 1965, bringing a camera and tape recorder to capture the war. This Memorial Day, his record of Vietnam premiers on 3net as Sky Soldier. Hear from Executive Producer Tom Jennings.

item.itunes:subtitle: Punch Television Network quietly started last October, and two weeks ago displayed what it's doing in public in Los Angeles. What Punch is up to is a diversity uppercut; lots more of it. The full story with Punch chief executive officer Joseph Collins.

item.title: Tomorrow Will Be Televised 3-26-12, Craig Henry
item.itunes:author: Simon Applebaum
item.itunes:subtitle: When people of color vanish or disappear, chances are it will not make local or national newscasts. TV One's new series Find Our Missing attempts to alter that outlook. TV One director of production Craig Henry explains.
